page.title: 08Inchnadamph Hotel
page.content: The busiest time of year is{May and {June.}Up to{50 people}can stay in the hotel at one time. Most like to go for drives while some fish and some walk looking for flowers and rocks. Many come for a rest.They are all ages from primary school pupils to 90 year_olds. The hotel closes from Oct to March for repairs although the bar stays open. Up to 7,000 guests come per year, including sometimes Lords and Ladies. 14 staff are kept in the summer. In 1758 an inn was already well- established here and a licence to sell spirits was granted to Kenneth Mac- kenzie about 1775 for Â£6. The present owners came to Inchnadamph in{1919}and remember the difficulties of guests in travelling to and fro. They had to be collected from the station at Lairg or Invershin by car as "well_appointed" hire cars were kept at the hotel.
